citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Five bottles of drugs with expiration dates ranging from 2/2022 to 1/2023 were found in the prep kitchen. In the office
there was a bin labeled “medications” that was full of bottles of drugs with expired dates.
Each dealer shall maintain programs of adequate veterinary care that include the use of appropriate methods to prevent,
control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries. The use of expired drugs is not considered adequate veterinary care as
they may have reduced effectiveness or harmful effects. Expired drugs must not be used on regulated animals. Expired
drugs must either be labeled as expired and kept separate from current medications or disposed of to ensure animals
receive the effective and proper treatment for illnesses and disease.
Correct by March 31, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee and facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
Five bottles of drugs with expiration dates ranging from 2/2022 to 1/2023 were found in the prep kitchen. In the office 
there was a bin labeled “medications” that was full of bottles of drugs with expired dates.  
 
Each dealer shall maintain programs of adequate veterinary care that include the use of appropriate methods to prevent, 
control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries. The use of expired drugs is not considered adequate veterinary care as 
they may have reduced effectiveness or harmful effects. Expired drugs must not be used on regulated animals. Expired 
drugs must either be labeled as expired and kept separate from current medications or disposed of to ensure animals 
receive the effective and proper treatment for illnesses and disease.  
 
Correct by March 31, 2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee and facility representatives. 
 
 n
